name: M. M. Hashmi Sarker
bio: I’m a fact-checker and investigative journalist with over five years of experience in digital journalism and multimedia reporting. A graduate of Comilla University’s Mass Communication and Journalism department, I have spent the last two and a half years debunking nearly 700 pieces of misinformation using advanced verification and OSINT tools. My work focuses on accountability, context, and protecting the public’s right to accurate information.
mission: To protect the public’s right to accurate and reliable information by rigorously verifying claims, exposing misinformation, and strengthening trust in journalism through transparent, evidence-based reporting. I am committed to using fact-checking as a form of accountability journalism—challenging false narratives, scrutinizing power, and empowering audiences to navigate an increasingly complex information environment.
vision: I envision an information ecosystem where facts are valued, journalism is trusted, and misinformation struggles to survive Through investigative reporting, fact-checking, and media literacy initiatives, I aim to contribute to a more informed society—one where people can make decisions based on verified information rather than manipulation or disinformation.
